paper_abstract: We study properties of vacancies in solid He-4 using Path Integral Monte Carlo. We find, in agreement with other calculations, that the energy to create a single vacancy is 11.5 K and is monotonic with the number of vacancies. If more then a few percent of the system becomes vacant,we find the system becomes unstable to melting. We show the number of exchanges in the system is increased by vacancies and how the underlying lattice is altered by the presence of a vacancy. We also examine the efficacy of using a tight binding Hamiltonian to describe the vacancy in the crystal, show that vacancies are attractive, and find values for the effective mass and inter-vacancy attraction. paper_title: Path integral calculations of vacancies in solid Helium
